alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 17 at 2:01PM PST until December 19 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE TONIGHT THROUGH THE WEEKEND FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST... .A winter storm will spread snow into the Cascades Friday night with snow becoming heavy Saturday morning through Saturday night. Travel will be difficult over Stevens Pass with this winter storm. Snow is expected to decrease by late Sunday morning. Snow will spread east impacting eastern Washington and northern Idaho including the Spokane to Coeur d`Alene metro areas. Heavy snow will persist in the Idaho Panhandle mountains into early next week. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches in the valleys and 5 to 10 inches in the mountains possible. * WHERE...Chewelah, Colville, Northport, Flowery Trail Road, Orin-Rice Road, Newport, Deer Park, Springdale-Hunters Road, and Kettle Falls. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
